thread.title: InventHelp® Client's Invention Designed to Locate Lost Items (DEG-178)
thread.title_full: InventHelp® Client's Invention Designed to Locate Lost Items (DEG-178)

author: Gia DelliGatti
title: InventHelp® Client's Invention Designed to Locate Lost Items (DEG-178)
text:
“I got tired of endlessly searching for lost items like the remote control,” said an inventor, from Marengo, Iowa. “I thought there should be a way to find lost items faster, so I came up with this.” He invented the Remote Finder. The Remote Finder enables an individual to easily locate lost items such as keys or a remote control. In doing so, it eliminates the need to replace lost items. As a result, it helps to reduce frustrations. The invention features a convenient design that is easy to use and it helps to save time. Additionally, the Remote Finder is producible in design variations.
The inventor described the invention design. “My design makes it easy to locate lost times.”
The original design was submitted to the Des Moines office of InventHelp. It is licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 13-DEG-178, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - [ https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp.
